Class CircularArrayQueue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • CircularArrayQueue<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of object to be stored in the CircularArrayQueue
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.util.Collection<T>, java.util.Queue<T>

    public class CircularArrayQueue<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Queue<T>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<T>
    Copyright (C) 2015 David Brown. Permission is granted to copy, distribute and/or modify this document under the terms of the GNU Free Documentation License, Version 1.3 or any later version published by the Free Software Foundation; with no Invariant Sections, no Front-Cover Texts, and no Back-Cover Texts. A copy of the license is included in the section entitled "GNU Free Documentation License". Resizable circular array queue implementation of the List interface. Implements all optional methods. Provides constant time access for size, add (although this is amortized constant time), remove operations.
    Author:
    David Brown
    See Also:
    Queue, Collection, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int capacity
      Current capacity of the queue (equal to the size of the elements array, not necessarily equal to the number of visible elements in the queue to the user).
      private static int DEFAULT_CAPACITY
      The default capacity of the queue when none is provided by the user.
      private T[] elements
      Underlying array storing elements which have been added to the queue.
      private int head
      Current location of the head pointer.
      private int mods
      Number of modifications made to the elements in this queue.
      private static long serialVersionUID
      Generated serial ID for serialization of this collection.
      private int size
      Current size or number of elements in the queue.
      private int tail
      Location of the tail pointer, will point to the same element as the head pointer if the size is 0, or if the number of elements in the elements, array is the same as the capacity of the elements array.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        Generated serial ID for serialization of this collection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_CAPACITY

        private static final int DEFAULT_CAPACITY
        The default capacity of the queue when none is provided by the user.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • elements

        private T[] elements
        Underlying array storing elements which have been added to the queue.

      • capacity

        private int capacity
        Current capacity of the queue (equal to the size of the elements array, not necessarily equal to the number of visible elements in the queue to the user).

      • tail

        private int tail
        Location of the tail pointer, will point to the same element as the head pointer if the size is 0, or if the number of elements in the elements, array is the same as the capacity of the elements array. Points to the element after the last accessible element in the queue, i.e. the one that will be replaced next upon an add(T e) method call.

      • head

        private int head
        Current location of the head pointer. Points to the next element in the array to be removed, so the first element which is accessible via the normal remove method from the queue interface.

      • size

        private int size
        Current size or number of elements in the queue. Equal to the number of accessible elements, not the size of the underlying array

      • mods

        private int mods
        Number of modifications made to the elements in this queue. For use when checking for ConcurrentModificationExceptions to be thrown

    • Constructor Detail

      • CircularArrayQueue

        public CircularArrayQueue(int initialCapacity)
        Used to create a queue with an initial capacity, useful if the user knows roughly what size queue will be required ahead of time to limit the number of resizing operations
        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - The capacity with which to create the queue

      • CircularArrayQueue

        public CircularArrayQueue(java.util.Collection<? extends T> c,
                          int initialCapacity)
        Used to specify a collection to add to the queue initially, along with an initial capacity. The inial capacity is not allowed to be smaller than the given collection. If the collection is null, a null pointer exception is thrown. If these two conditions are not met, the queue is created with the specified default capacity, and the elements from the given collection are added to the queue.
        Parameters:
        c - The collection from which to copy all the elements from initially.
        initialCapacity - The initial capacity of which to start the queue with. Useful if the user knows the size of the queue is likely to grow to a certain size.

      • CircularArrayQueue

        public CircularArrayQueue(java.util.Collection<? extends T> c)
        Constructor to create a queue with a given collection of elements. Given collection must not be null. The inital size of the queue is made to be equal to the size of the given collection.
        Parameters:
        c - The collection from which to add all elements from initally upon creating a queue.

      • CircularArrayQueue

        public CircularArrayQueue()
        Default constructor used to create a queue when the size it may expand to is not well known beforehand

      • resize

        private void resize(int newCap)
        Local operation used to resize the element array when the current capacity is reached, and trying to add a new element. Generates a new array with twice the current capacity, and iterates from the current head pointer, to the current tail pointer, adding all the elements to this new object array. The current element array is then set to this new one, and the relevant pointers are reset.
        Parameters:
        newCap - The new capacity with which to resize the underlying array

      • removeAll

        public boolean removeAll(java.util.Collection<?> c)

      • retainAll

        public boolean retainAll(java.util.Collection<?> c)
        Specified by:
        retainAll in interface java.util.Collection<T>

      • compareRemove

        private boolean compareRemove(java.util.Collection<?> c,
                              boolean mod)
        Used to remove elements in this queue based on the elements in the given collection. Iterates through reachable elements in the queue, and checks if the given collection also has this element. If it does, and the flag is true, this current element from the queue is removed, if the flag is false, then it is kept. The reverse is also true. If the collection does not have this element, and the flag is true, the element is kept, otherwise if the collection does not have this element, and the flag is false, this element is removed.
        Parameters:
        c - The collection from which to compare this queue's elements.
        mod - The flag to specify removal of an element of not based on if the given collection has the same element
        Returns:
        Returns true if the queue was modified, false if it was not
